metadata.name: Alien Cities #63
metadata.description:
Alien Cities depicts fictional cities as they might look on another planet. Alien Cities are fractals, and can seem semi organic in nature. However, if you look close, you can see that each structure is sealed off from the atmosphere, showing its artificial nature.

Since Alien cities are a fractal, they have an almost infinite number of variations. In fact, taming the variability is one of the biggest challenges when using fractals. 

Alien Cities is coded using shaders, so it renders instantaneously on any size screen. The default view is gpu friendly, in that it will stop redrawing after a second or two. However, a gpu is recommended since it is a shader. See below about using the camera.

Variations:

- 22 hand tuned palettes.
- Fx, Fy, Fz control height and x/y spread of features.
- Angle controls the angles of the fractal folds. This has a large effect on the overall look of the city. If you get an angle close to a multiple of 90, the city will look much like a normal city block.
- Radius controls the size of the features in the fractal, and has a large effect on the height of the features.
- Being a fractal ensures all cities will be unique.

Keys: 

's' saves a png in the exact size of the screen.

Camera:

If you add ?allowCamera=1 to the url after you open it in a separate browser window, you can use the camera. Note that this will constantly use gpu resources, as it is redrawing every frame. If you minimize the browser window, chrome is smart enough to stop rendering.

The camera is an orbit camera with the following controls:

- left mouse drag rotates the scene around the center.
- right mouse drag pans the scene (moves the center of the scene).
- mouse wheel zooms in and out.

Zooming out will show the entire city as an island floating in space. Zooming in will show the details of the fractal, which can be quite intricate.

metadata.name: Impressions of Order #69
metadata.description:
â€˜Impressions of Orderâ€™ is a collection of 300 generative compositions. 

Inspired by 90s ROM cartridges, server farms and future cityscapes this project explores perception and documentation of â€˜orderâ€™ within complex systems. 

--------------------------------------------------------

This artwork is best enjoyed in high-resolution so that the subtle layering, colour shifts, variation in hard and soft edges, faint impressions of construction, and the various low-probability glitchy events can be fully appreciated. 

By default, the artwork will load in 2K resolution (1400 x 2000 px). It is recommended that you view the work in 4K or 6K to appreciate the finer details. 

The keyboard buttons: â€œ2â€, â€œ4â€, and â€œ6â€ can be pressed to change the resolution to 2K, 4K and 6K resolution accordingly. 

To download an image at its current resolution, press the keyboard button â€œSâ€.

--------------------------------------------------------

Artwork created with p5.js

@nbswwit
Sept 2022

until we meet again
in that space we've always occupied

â€¨Created by Quentin HocdÃ©, in Amalfi (Italia).

metadata.name: Ries #388
metadata.description:
Ries is 500 sheets of paper. 
Ries is an cut-up text-artwork.
Ries is artwork generated by an algorithm based on seeded random numbers.
Ries is a digital artwork installed in 5 forms in exhibitions setting.
Ries is an NFT artwork. 

Ries is an artwork where I try bring together my experience of doing gallery exhibitions, my love for generative and copy machine art, DIY-punk aesthetics, NFTâ€™s and chaos. 

The edition of Ries will be installed in different forms and collages in a gallery exhibition in Walden Kunstaustellungen in Berlin in July of 2022. Opening is at 8.7. 19.00, welcome if you are in Berlin.
/www.galerie-walden.de/

The seed idea for the project was the method of cut-up where a text (or something else) is cut into pieces and then rearranged to form something new. A modified Markovâ€™s Chain algorithm makes a small text or a group of words from a pool of texts that include Art texts about cut up technique and generative art talk from tweets. These words form a visual bottom layer and then another layer of words samples the first, cutting it up and thus following the theme of the artwork.

Since the single iterations of the project are designed to be used in a collage, they come in various tone, density, detail and scale. One can test from the variations button and get a sense of what the generator produces. 

Controls in live view:
-Pressing  j exports the current image as jpeg
-Pressing  p  exports the current image as png

To change the detail level one can access the pixel density of render by adding ?pixDens=4 to the end of the URL in live view. You can of course you any number other than 4 also. I it renders just a black image, you have to lower the number, since it is then too large for WEBGL to render.

Designed to be best rendered on desktop Chrome.

Pricing info
22 tez - Includes a gallery shown, signed print sent to minter by mail or by telefax(!)
11 tez - A fair price for an artwork, also the minter can personally pick up a signed gallery shown print from the gallery, after the exhibition.
5 tez - 1/2 fair price
2 tez - bottom dollar

If you minted on lower tiers and would want a print, please contact the artist per twitter dm to â€œupgradeâ€. If you bought secondary, and would want a print, please contact the artist per twitter dm.

Features exist mostly to help with artwork pairing for the collectors.


Markovâ€™s chain code core is based on Markov Me! By https://codepen.io/alexkramerbanjo , MIT License

Displacement shader based on the wonderful shader examples by Adam Ferris


The artist holds the right to use the whole edition of Ries for display purposes for future exhibitions without asking permission or notifying the owners of the NFTâ€™s.

1.7.2022 in Berlin
Antti Pussinen

www.anttipussinen.net
www.twitter.com/antti_pussinen
www.instagram.com/anttipussinen

metadata.name: Schematics #79
metadata.description:
These recovered schematics seem to be alien in nature. The technology is beyond our grasp, be we can infer these schematics generate structures. The schematic itself is encoded in the same common mathematical language as the structures it generates.

Responsive Rendering

Schematics is coded using shaders, and renders instantaneously on any size screen. It is also GPU friendly, in that it will not consume any gpu resource after the first frame is rendered.  Since it is a shader, a gpu is recommended.

Keys: 

's' saves a png in the exact size of the screen.

metadata.name: Rainbow Snake #91
metadata.description: Rainbow snakes painting geometric niceties.

metadata.name: Sunlit Sanctuary #56
metadata.description:
[ CLICK TO START THE SOUND ]

Welcome to the Sunlit Sanctuary, where the warm rays of the sun dance along its daily trajectory. As the sun's light illuminates the space, it gently caresses the musical instruments scattered throughout the sanctuary, coaxing them into producing a symphony of harmonious sounds. You can enjoy the pre-made animation or take control of it yourself!

Controls
[ f ] - fullscreen
[ s ] - save the current frame as an image
[ cursor / finger ] - control the position of the sun

Created with Three.js & Tone.js
Copyright (c) March 2023 Shaderism

metadata.name: Reverberations #34
metadata.description:
[ CLICK TO START THE SOUND ]
Best viewed on a decent GPU for 60fps rendering
Play the instrument by clicking or touching the blobs
Supports any aspect ratio, however the resulting simulation will vary!

Everything in the universe is made up of vibrating energy, including us. Our thoughts and emotions are also vibrations of energy that influence the frequencies around us. 
Be kind.

Controls
[ click / touch ] - split blobs
[ /?play ] - query string to avoid automatic splits
[ s ] - save image
[ f ] - full screen

Created with Three.js + Rapier.js + Tone.js
Copyright (c) August 2022 Shaderism

metadata.name: (recombination/perspectives)-I: Horizons #84
metadata.description:
ðŸŒŠ ðŸŒž ðŸŒˆ ðŸŒ…


    ( r e c o m b i n a t i o n  /  p e r s p e c t i v e s ) 


                     IÂ :   H o r i z o n s


                            âœ¨ ðŸ§¬ ðŸ§¡ â²







-----
* What/How *

2 560 000 particles are subjected to a succession of 64 energy bursts which scatters the points through space. 
The algorithm then stores 3 configurations of points, forming an entangled coherent system.
After few seconds multiple observation modalities are then selected sequentially to allow for dynamic and contemplative visualization.

-----
* Mint preview *

Minter will get a 2160x2160 PNG bitmap and an infinite randomly deterministic animation.

-----
* Technics *

This experience is designed to be executed on a recent GPU (>2016) and displayed on 16/9 screens from FHD to 8K+ (1920x1080 â†’ 7680x4320) at 60FPS for infinite duration.

- JavaScript / ThreeJS / WebGL / GLSL
- Unique generative, random and determinist animation (animation is seeded by the fxhash mint hash)
- Infinite animation
- Animation sequences duration between 6 and 60 seconds.

-----
* Controls *

Keyboard "Space" : take a PNG capture of the current view frame (same ratio as window, max 1920x1080)

Keyboard "X"Â : skip current animation sequence / next sequence

-----
* URL modifiers *

"&fastdemo=on"
Forces animation sequences to last 10 seconds instead of random durations.

"&slow=on"
Forces animation sequences to last 1 minute instead of random durations.

"&static=on"
Disables animation automatic start. Press "X" to start animations.


-----
@HAL09999 â€“ January 25th, 2023

metadata.name: AllÃ©gories boolÃ©ennes #435
metadata.description:
"AllÃ©gories boolÃ©ennes" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at PARIS+ par Art Basel

This work is a continuation of research around the intersections of shapes that I have been exploring for a while. I wonder about the way in which they make it possible to bring out new compositions from superpositions of shapes that could initially represent a real disorder.

Controls:
â€¢ "a": Play the animation
â€¢ "s": Export the image (default 2160â€ŠÃ—â€Š3840px PNG)
â€¢ "h": Change export settings to high resolution (then press "s" to export a 6480â€ŠÃ—11520px PNG)
â€¢ "m": Change export settings to medium resolution (then press "s" to export a 4320â€ŠÃ—â€Š7680px PNG)
â€¢ "n": Back to 2160â€ŠÃ—â€Š3840px

Artwork by Julien Espagnon, 2022.

metadata.name: soft spot #45
metadata.description:
soft spot is my first published generative token.
It's the result of my curiosity in exploring dots, light and blending modes.
It features 3 possible backgrounds and 5 different palettes
and takes around 20-30s to draw so please be patient.

"S" will save a PNG from canvas using current resolution
-----------------------------------------------------
Many thanks to the inspiring notochord.xyz programming courses,
and also @nudoru, whose write up on generative brushes was a great
source on figuring out the material in which I want to draw();

written in js.

metadata.name: GEN XYZ Das Occult #728
metadata.description:
A 10k Generative Profile Pic collection
GEN XYZ Das Occult - by culla - @tamccullough

move over cryptopunks
there is a new group on the scene

100% code - not an image composition

A bunch of common palettes
A selection of rare palettes
And a smaller set of ultra rare palettes
However, rarity will be based on what combinations the code produces

The majority of tokens will not have a special trait
However your token might have one or even multiple special traits
But, be aware that only the last special trait added will be listed in the features

Even then, look closely, because not all aspects of the canvas are included in the features. Collectors should still look closely and choose what they like when buying on secondary.

Which team are you on? X or O?

follow culla on twitter for updates. Or maybe __acolyte__

If the non reserved tokens mint out quickly, Access List mints will have 24 hours to mint reserves assigned to those wallets

Thank you for supporting an emerging artist in the generative art space

Access List reserves were given to holders of the following PFP collections created by culla
2x for each Basqunk held
1x for each Inkspunk, TwoFourQunk, V0iD, DeeManz, Punkasso and CR0$$KULL
You would have needed to transfer the above tokens to your mint wallet at the time of the snapshot

share your tokens on social media with #genxyznft
Made with love by culla using p5.js
